messages.subject: Re: Cleaning - Was: "What was I thinking" was Telling our kids the
messages.msgSnippet: It s amazing how everything just always comes together exactly when it is supposed to. I have been having some rough days. My youngest (4 1/2, almost 5) has
messages.messageBody:
It's amazing how everything just always comes together exactly when it is
supposed to. I have been having some rough days. My youngest (4 1/2, almost
5) has become quite the "dumper" over the last couple weeks. She seems bored
and I am working on helping her, but for a couple months some neighborhood
kids were coming over everyday to play, but they haven't come in about 2
weeks now. It seems like I am just not enough and my oldest doesn't want to
play much with her either.

Anyway, right now we have puzzle peices from a huge US map scattered on the
floor, cotton balls, playing cards, flash cards, blankets, pillows, books
and toys. It's overwhelming and the last couple days I feel like I am being
"walked all over" because "no one will help me pick it up". How martyr-y is
that?

Well, thank you Rebecca for posting what I needed to post myself and for all
the replies as well.

--
Amanda
http://hopescreations.blogspot.com/
http://whatmykidstaughtme.blogspot.com/
http://365daysofsparkle.blogspot.com/


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
